attributes.action: Reform the UK political system to make the PM directly elected by the public
attributes.additional_details: Amend the UK political system so that the role of Prime Minister is directly elected by the public.  In the circumstances that a Prime Minister is removed from their position, via resignation, retirement, removal by their party/Parliament or death, then an immediate Prime Ministerial election should be called.
attributes.background: Six of the last seven Prime Ministers of the UK were appointed by means other than with support of the UK public via a General Election: Gordon Brown, Theresa May, Boris Johnson, Liz Truss, Rishi Sunak. Democratically, we need to ensure our leader is appointed by the public and no other means.

rejection.details:
We think this petition is similar

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/620016

As the Prime Minister holds office by virtue of having majority support in the House of Commons, we're not sure other than via a General Election how you would like the Prime Minister to be elected by the public and hold office.
